subject: Avoid unconditional fact gathering
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-02 14:09:28.000000000', 'files': ['releasenotes/notes/avoid-unconditional-fact-gathering-94760984b2de0796.yaml', 'ansible/gather-facts.yml'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible/commit/bfc4354905e63f2165454d73c44fa7664bdb3ad9', 'message': "Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)
"}]
commit_message:
Avoid unconditional fact gathering

One way to improve the performance of Ansible is through fact caching.
Rather than gather facts in every play, we can configure Ansible to
cache them in a persistent store. An example Ansible configuration for
doing this is as follows:

[defaults]
gathering = smart
fact_caching = jsonfile
fact_caching_connection = ./facts
fact_caching_timeout = 86400

This does not affect Kolla Ansible however, since we use the setup
module which unconditionally gathers facts regardless of the state of
the cache. This gets worse with large inventories limited to a small
batch of hosts via --limit or serial, since the limited hosts must
gather facts for all others.

One way to detect whether facts exist for a host is via the
'module_setup' variable, which exists only when facts exist. This change
uses the 'module_setup' fact to determine whether facts need to be
gathered for hosts outside of the batch. For hosts in the batch, we
switch from using the setup module to gather_facts on the play, which
can use the 'smart' gathering logic.

Change-Id: I04841fb62b2e1d9e97ce4b75ce3a7349b9c74036
Partially-Implements: blueprint performance-improvements
(cherry picked from commit e0ba55a85d617c12f51be41c10778696ffc5004c)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/88/732688/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # building their configurations. gather_facts: true tasks: when: - not hostvars[item].module_setup | default(false)
deleted_lines: # building their configurations. The below 'gather_facts' # set to 'false' is a bit confusing but this is to avoid # Ansible gathering facts twice. gather_facts: false tasks: - name: Gather facts setup: when: item not in ansible_play_batch

commit_message:
CI: reduce memory and disk for testing nodes

There is not reason to use 10 or 12G of disk for Cirros.

Also change the RAM to 512M, although we'll have to revert it back
on master and ussuri once we switch to DIB images by default.

Conflicts:
	scripts/test-bifrost.sh

Change-Id: Ibada78686ffb4db1d8dae05acf980081d5265fc6
(cherry picked from commit 85e1b8207885d64daf986158dba8768ae49b257e)

commit_message:
Add std-with-versions stable-branch-type

This adds a new std-with-versions branch type. This is used to control
validation logic when branching to allow the Ironic team to create
intermediary stable branches based on major.minor version numbers in
addition to our normal expected stable/$series branches.

https://specs.openstack.org/openstack/ironic-specs/specs/not-implemented/new-release-model.html

Change-Id: Ic482c77a2c177162ffe37643a455ac1724a658b3
Signed-off-by: Sean McGinnis <sean.mcginnis@gmail.com>

commit_message:
Clean up remainders of USE_SYSTEMD and logging setup

We dropped the ability to override USE_SYSTEMD to False when we deleted
screen support in [0], so we can also clean up any conditionals based
on it.

Also clean up the logging setup functions, dropping local vars for
parameters that we don't actually support anymore.

[0] I8c27182f60b0f5310b3a8bf5feb02beb7ffbb26a

Change-Id: I5cbce9f2c42e111761e8689447b3f8cbb7ea2eb5

commit_message:
Oslo releases for 2020-06-03

I'm not sure all of these strictly need to be released, but some of
the projects had quite a few patches piling up which makes it harder
to tell at a glance whether there are release-worthy patches. Things
like the doc requirements changes may be helpful for packagers too.

Change-Id: I21a5e8a7ca283f4739bf9ead31a66d54f3d7cf82

commit_message:
Simplify setting task "started_at" and "finished_at"

* Moving the responsibility to manage values of these timestamps
  into the method Task.set_state() so that this logic is now
  fully associated with how task execution state changes.

Change-Id: I13a5a5921dea06cee7f3efd53af5c327fe89a180

commit_message:
Ensure net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6=0

Along the same lines as https://review.opendev.org/#/c/580460/.

Currently, the Erlang Port Mapper Daemon requires that the loopback
interface supports IPv6 in order to initialize properly.
Without that, rabbitmq-server cannot start and deployment fails at step 2.

Until the startup behaviour of epmd is amended, do not disable inet6 support
on loopback device to workaround the problem.

Change-Id: Ia747103aca99f3f45d7705248c6c1ef19aa93d71
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/98/732098/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix devstack default settings in aarch64

1. Lack qemu-efi in ubuntu
2. Lack edk2.git-aarch64 in Fedora/Centos
3. Remove NOVNC disable.

Change-Id: Ifbd0c386df6b28bc64cef20cab8e08f99a85c782
Signed-off-by: Kevin Zhao <kevin.zhao@linaro.org>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/86/723286/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: if is_arch "aarch64"; then install_package qemu-efi fi if is_arch "aarch64"; then install_package edk2.git-aarch64 fi

commit_message:
CI: raise DIB jobs memory to 3 GiB

The only reason the current 2 GiB nodes work is because DIB started
removing linux-firmware from its images. Unfortunately, we need this
package on bare metal, and readding it brings to 3 GiB consumption.

Change-Id: I2663bca37c87c09441621755639f4cebc7d2b0a5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/69/727169/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-21 14:37:31.000000000', 'files': ['doc/source/admin/drivers/idrac.rst'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/ironic/commit/475682f9b9acb9fce4bb0c759939eb4f4b24a4ce', 'message': 'Remove iDRAC Redfish boot device known issue

Change-Id: I5556e18f51e066f7acbf5332ca3a498140b0a7e2

commit_message:
Remove iDRAC Redfish boot device known issue

Since workaround is implemented in Redfish driver,
it works without setting force_persistent_boot_device to Never.

Change-Id: I5556e18f51e066f7acbf5332ca3a498140b0a7e2
(cherry picked from commit 4ae482897a5ad055233cbffe82c348f530da7dc0)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/ironic refs/changes/83/729983/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: Redfish management interface failure to set boot device ------------------------------------------------------- When using the ``idrac-redfish`` management interface with certain iDRAC firmware versions (at least versions 2.70.70.70, 4.00.00.00, and 4.10.10.10) and attempting to set the boot device on a baremetal server that is configured to UEFI boot, the iDRAC will return the following error:: Unable to Process the request because the value entered for the parameter Continuous is not supported by the implementation. To work around this issue, set the ``force_persistent_boot_device`` parameter in ``driver-info`` on the node to ``Never`` by running the following command from the command line: .. code-block:: bash openstack baremetal node set --driver-info \ force_persistent_boot_device=Never ${node_uuid}

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ia60c23576e6a36634540032c83b38440de4771d8
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/bashate refs/changes/60/732760/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-22 10:18:42.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/zaqar/commit/7f02083a786a828a9f16d0f02b740349e06c96f2', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always
used 'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx'
can lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not
needed during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the
renames before the next release removes them. A couple of variables
are also not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie623e7a2389c292ffc71a285f0fc2d4bb9820c3f

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always
used 'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx'
can lead to some strange rendering.

Remove docs requirements from lower-constraints, they are not
needed during install or test but only for docs building.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the
renames before the next release removes them. A couple of variables
are also not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ie623e7a2389c292ffc71a285f0fc2d4bb9820c3f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/zaqar refs/changes/90/730290/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: pygments_style = 'native'# Options for openstackdocstheme openstackdocs_repo_name = 'openstack/zaqar' openstackdocs_bug_project = 'zaqar' openstackdocs_bug_tag = ''
deleted_lines: pygments_style = 'sphinx'# -- Options for openstackdocstheme ------------------------------------------- repository_name = 'openstack/zaqar' bug_project = 'zaqar' bug_tag = ''

commit_message:
Add support for encrypting glance api

Add TLS support for glance api using stunnel to do TLS termination.

Partially-Implements: blueprint add-ssl-internal-network
Change-Id: Ib512ba20724b95e299beb829af493db6e5465797
Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/720850
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/31/707131/26 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Improve Ansible version check error handling

* Run the Ansible version check after the kolla_ansible python import
  test. This should help with 'forgot to activate virtualenv' issues.
* Check for failure of ansible command when version checking, provide a
  different message.

Change-Id: I51984e96b44ced3c27f735341814c53a88b50fa5
Related: blueprint ansible-max-version
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/61/705261/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: ANSIBLE_VERSION_HOST=$(set -o pipefail && ansible --version | head -n1 | egrep -o '[0-9]\.[0-9]+') if [[ $? -ne 0 ]] || [[ $ANSIBLE_VERSION_HOST = "" ]]; then echo "ERROR: Unable to detect Ansible version. Is Ansible installed?" exit 1 ficheck_ansible_compatibility

You can enable this hybrid setting by configuring " "both your database and cache as discussed above and then using" msgstr "" "Um die Leistungsprobleme bei Datenbankabfragen zu verringern, können Sie " "auch das Sitzungs-Backend `` cached_db`` von Django verwenden, das sowohl " "Ihre Datenbank- als auch die Caching-Infrastruktur verwendet, um " "Durchschreib-Caching und effizientes Abrufen durchzuführen. Sie können diese " "Hybrideinstellung aktivieren, indem Sie sowohl Ihre Datenbank als auch den " "Cache wie oben beschrieben konfigurieren und dann verwenden" msgid ""msgid "" "Ussuri release uses Django 2.2 (the latest LTS) as the primary Django " "version. The prevouos LTS of Django 1.11 will be dropped during Ussuri " "cycle. subject: Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-23 21:29:06.000000000', 'files': ['tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/monasca-transform/commit/4802d8e1bc4805f014eebbdac4578ddeb7517014', 'message': 'Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifedeae4a7030e4a5cc7252883b1db51047d2f01e
'}]
commit_message:
Update TOX_CONSTRAINTS_FILE for stable/ussuri

Update the URL to the upper-constraints file to point to the redirect
rule on releases.openstack.org so that anyone working on this branch
will switch to the correct upper-constraints list automatically when
the requirements repository branches.

Until the requirements repository has as stable/ussuri branch, tests will
continue to use the upper-constraints list on master.

Change-Id: Ifedeae4a7030e4a5cc7252883b1db51047d2f01e

commit_message:
Use tag for dib

Stable/train and older branches have py27 support, since diskimage-builder
removed the support we can't relly on the master branch. Let's use the
tag 2.38.0 since still provides py27 support.

Change-Id: I378510457650e1502fb4c30b13601b222b289825

commit_message:
Custom haproxy script for monitoring galera

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/710217/

Change-Id: I85652f23e487c40192106d23f2cdd45a3077deca
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kolla-ansible refs/changes/13/710213/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: #!/bin/bash MYSQL_USER=haproxy MYSQL_HOST=$3 MYSQL_PORT=$4 MYSQL_CONNECT_STRING="mysql -nNE --connect-timeout=${MYSQL_TIMEOUT} \ --user=${MYSQL_USER} \ --host=${MYSQL_HOST} \ --port=${MYSQL_PORT}" WSREP_STATE=$(${MYSQL_CONNECT_STRING} -e "SHOW STATUS LIKE 'wsrep_local_state';" | tail -1) if [[ "${WSREP_STATE}" != "4" ]]; then exit 1 fi

commit_message:
Switch to Monasca API for logs

The Monasca Log API has been removed and in this change we switch
to using the unified API. If dedicated log APIs are required then
this can be supported through configuration. Out of the box the
Monasca API is used for both logs and metrics which is envisaged to
work for most use cases.

In order to use the unified API for logs, we need to disable the
legacy Kafka client. We also rename the Monasca API config file
to remove a warning about using the old style name.

Depends-On: https://review.opendev.org/#/c/728638
Change-Id: I9b6bf5b6690f4b4b3445e7d15a40e45dd42d2e84

commit_message:
Fix glance backend TLS configuration task

Fix glance configuration task to create the backend PEM only on hosts with
glance service enabled.

Change-Id: I641c51761a99828854aafcc1e7354d6932d86659

Use unittest.mock instead of third party mock

Now that we no longer support py27, we can use the standard library
unittest.mock module instead of the third party mock lib.

commit_message:
Stop to use the __future__ module.

The __future__ module [1] was used in this context to ensure compatibility
between python 2 and python 3.

We previously dropped the support of python 2.7 [2] and now we only support
python 3 so we don't need to continue to use this module and the imports
listed below.

Imports commonly used and their related PEPs:
- `division` is related to PEP 238 [3]
- `print_function` is related to PEP 3105 [4]
- `unicode_literals` is related to PEP 3112 [5]
- `with_statement` is related to PEP 343 [6]
- `absolute_import` is related to PEP 328 [7]

[1] https://docs.python.org/3/library/__future__.html
[2] https://governance.openstack.org/tc/goals/selected/ussuri/drop-py27.html
[3] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0238
[4] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3105
[5] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-3112
[6] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0343
[7] https://www.python.org/dev/peps/pep-0328

Change-Id: Ifa2e16df273a2d272a6631a70ee94c76f8e3716e

commit_message:
Ensure allowed_cidrs field is present on older openstacksdk versions

As openstacksdk 0.36.0 is needed on lower-constraints and it
does not support allowed_cidrs field on the listener, we must
ensure that field is present to properly update the listeners ACLs.

Closes-bug: 1881914
Change-Id: I46d14e9088a0643ba02b0a7d4c8000fa2a22d379
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/kuryr-kubernetes refs/changes/48/733148/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from openstack.load_balancer.v2 import listener as os_listener # TODO(maysams): We need to manually insert allowed_cidrs option # as it's only supported from 0.41.0 version. Remove it once # lower-constraints supports it. os_listener.Listener.allowed_cidrs = os_resource.Body('allowed_cidrs', type=list)

commit_message:
Ensure ipv6 loopback is alrways present for epmd

With the refactoring of kernel sysctl from puppet to ansible [1],
we lost a sysctl flag that is required to ensure that epmd can
start even when a host has IPv6 networking disabled globally [2].

Re-introduce the missing sysctl setting.

Closes-Bug: #1880967

[1] I30270943aa66a8a982657af3d7d59b8425534b0d
[2] I200acaeaca15e47dc2e3b2462a6254e85477ffb0

Change-Id: I9e666e905d00e8fc539abd2932d1463d1b1a74db
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tripleo-heat-templates refs/changes/41/731241/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # always allow ipv6 on loopback for rabbitmq, see +bug/1780065 net.ipv6.conf.lo.disable_ipv6: value: 0

commit_message:
Cleanup docs building

This repo is now testing only with Python 3, so let's make
a few cleanups:
- Remove obsolete sections from setup.cfg
- Switch to using sphinx-build
- Remove install_command from tox.ini, the default is fine
- cleanup tox.ini
- Update pbr requirement

Change-Id: I0adc74190fa820434a46b2a6bf9247ca6eb3e51d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-specs refs/changes/65/733465/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: install_command = pip install -U {opts} {packages}basepython = python3basepython = python3 commands = python setup.py build_sphinx

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-05-31 15:50:18.000000000', 'files': ['requirements.txt', 'doc/source/conf.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/magnum-specs/commit/eb7c9799991d189a6ed021b4a6db48eb321cf454', 'message': "Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I9dbba04f3918ced819e9e69a58bc5e580ad5d538
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/magnum-specs refs/changes/20/732020/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # openstackdocstheme options openstackdocs_repo_name = 'openstack/magnum-specs' openstackdocs_auto_name = False openstackdocs_use_storyboard = True pygments_style = 'native'
deleted_lines: pygments_style = 'sphinx'# If not '', a 'Last updated on:' timestamp is inserted at every page bottom, # using the given strftime format. html_last_updated_fmt = '%Y-%m-%d %H:%M'

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme version

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 version. Using
this version will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Disable openstackdocs_auto_name to use 'project' variable as name.

Change pygments_style to 'native' since old theme version always used
'native' and the theme now respects the setting and using 'sphinx' can
lead to some strange rendering.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: I52f0ef0428168b2dcd75a32df1be2b455ee00d5d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-chef-specs refs/changes/50/732050/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Switch to newer openstackdocstheme and reno versions

Switch to openstackdocstheme 2.2.1 and reno 3.1.0 versions. Using
these versions will allow especially:
* Linking from HTML to PDF document
* Allow parallel building of documents
* Fix some rendering problems

Update Sphinx version as well.

Set openstackdocs_pdf_link to link to PDF file. Note that
the link to the published document only works on docs.openstack.org
where the PDF file is placed in the top-level html directory. The
site-preview places the PDF in a pdf directory.

openstackdocstheme renames some variables, so follow the renames
before the next release removes them. A couple of variables are also
not needed anymore, remove them.

See also
http://lists.openstack.org/pipermail/openstack-discuss/2020-May/014971.html

Change-Id: Ia41113e36cdf0c5a0821291494908070dd5f9138

commit_message:
CNF on Kubernetes cluster inside VM

This specification describes enhancement of
VNF Lifecycle Management for Container Network Function
on Kubernetes cluster in Virtual Machines.

The CNF instantiation/termination process will be splited into:
* VNF-A: VMs and set up Kubernetes cluster
* VNF-B: CNF on the Kubernetes cluster inside VNF-A

Blueprint: cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs
Change-Id: I9013ca13fb5351b54ec8cf52e9475a3efdaaa0ea
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tacker-specs refs/changes/83/731683/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: .. This work is licensed under a Creative Commons Attribution 3.0 Unported License. http://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/3.0/legalcode =================================== CNF on Kubernetes cluster inside VM =================================== https://blueprints.launchpad.net/tacker/+spec/cnf-support-with-etsi-nfv-specs This specification describes enhancement of VNF Lifecycle Management for Container Network Function in Tacker. Problem description =================== The Kubernetes infra driver in Tacker can deploy CNF on pre-installed Kubernetes cluster [#add-kubernetes-cnf-support]_. This specification proposes a way to deploy CNF when Kubernetes cluster is not present. The process will consist of VM instantiation, Kubernetes cluster installation on new VMs and CNF will be deployed on new Kubernetes cluster. Proposed Change =============== The CNF instantiation process will be split into two VNF instances. Both VNF instances will be created using single CSAR package. Let's call the two instances as VNF-A and VNF-B respectively. * VNF-A: Create VMs and set up Kubernetes cluster * VNF-B: Deploy CNF on the Kubernetes cluster inside VNF-A The VIM type and ``additionalParams`` parameter provided in the VNF instantiation request will be important part of this multi-stage deployment process. VNF-A: Create VMs and set up Kubernetes cluster ----------------------------------------------- .. code-block:: none +---------+ +---------+ | Cluster | | | | Install | | VNFD | | Script | | | +-------+-+ +-+-------+ | | +--------------+ v v +---------------+ | LCM operation| +----------+ | Instantiation | | User Data |------>| | | Request with | +--------------+ | CSAR | | Additional | +-----------+ +--->| | | Params | | Heat | | +----+-----+ +-+-------------+ | Template |--+ | | | (Base HOT)| | | +-----------+ +-----+----------+--------------+ | v v VNFM | | +-------------------+ | | | TackerServer | | | +-------+-----------+ | | | | | v | 2. Kubernetes Cluster | +----------------------+ | Installation | | +-------------+ | | +-------------+------------------------+--+----| VNF LCM | | | | | | | +-------------+ | | +-------|-------------|------------+ | | | | | | | | | | | | | +----|------+ +---|-------+ | | | | | | | v | | v | | | | +-------------+ | | | | +------+ | | +------+ | | 1. Create | | |OpenStack | | | | | |Worker| | | |Master| |<---------------+--+----|Infra Driver | | | | | +------+ | | +------+ | | VMs | | +-------------+ | | | | VM | | VM | | | | | | | +-----------+ +-----------+ | | | | | +----------------------------------+ | | Tacker Conductor| | +----------------------------------+ | +----------------------+ | | Hardware | | | | Resources | +-------------------------------+ | | +----------------------------------+ The diagram above describes the process involved in the instantiation of VNF-A. Create VMs ~~~~~~~~~~ VMs will be deployed using a Heat template provided in the CSAR as specified in `LCM-operation-with-user-data`_ specification. The reason is that the Kubernetes cluster will be set up with `Kuryr-Kubernetes`_. The cluster installation requires some essential network entities such as Router and LoadBalancer. TOSCA v1.2 has definition for LoadBalancer but it is not supported by heat-translator. Router definition is not present in TOSCA v1.2. TODO: What type of Kubernetes will be used in Tacker? It needs to be discussed in the community. Currently it is assumed that Kuryr-kubernetes will be used. .. note:: Although VM resource information can be included in VNFD in future, it is out of scope of this specification. Following components of CSAR package will be required for VM instantiation: * VNFD VNFD will not contain any VM resource information such as VDU, Connection points, Virtual links because all required components of VM will be specified in the heat template (Base HOT). * Heat template (Base HOT) The heat template will contain resource information for instantiation of VM and network entities such as Router, LoadBalancer. It will be used as mentioned in `LCM-operation-with-user-data`_ specification. * LCM operation user data It will contain a python module for processing parameters required for heat template provided in BaseHOT directory. It will be used as mentioned in `LCM-operation-with-user-data`_ specification. Below is a sample of body provided in the VNF instantiation request `POST /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId}/instantiate` .. code-block:: json { "flavourId": "cluster_install", "additionalParams": { "lcm-operation-user-data": "UserData/base_user_data.py", "lcm-operation-user-data-class": "BaseUserData", "instantiate_end": "Files/kubernetes/cluster_install.sh", }, "vimConnectionInfo": [ { "id": "8a3adb69-0784-43c7-833e-aab0b6ab4470", "vimId": "7dc3c839-bf15-45ac-8dff-fc5b95c2940e", "vimType": "openstack" } ] } | Kubernetes cluster installation ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This spec proposes a way to configure a Kubernetes cluster on the VM deployed in previous step. The cluster will be configured using a shell script provided as an artifact in the CSAR package. A ``UserScript`` module will be added in Tacker for executing the cluster installation script. The script also be responsible for returning the cluster access information. The cluster access information will be stored in the database as VIM connection info. An alternate approach for running Kubernetes cluster installation script is discussed in `Alternatives`_ section. .. note:: VNFM will access the artifacts directly from the VNF package. APIs specified by `Add-artifacts-support-for-VNF-package`_ will be used in future. The VNF LCM driver will need changes for: * Running the cluster installation script after VNF instantiation * Storing the script result as VIM connection info in the database The instantiation request will have ``instantiate_end`` parameter in ``additionalParams`` of the instantiation request. Its value will be a path of cluster installation shell script. When this parameter is present, the VNF LCM driver will use ``UserScript`` module to install Kubernetes cluster after VNF instantiation. The module will implement following interface: .. code-block:: python class AbstractUserScript(object): def run_script(self, script_path, **kwargs): """ runs the script provided in script_path Parameters provided in the kwargs will be passed to the script as arguments. The script should return the cluster information. """ The ``run_script()`` function will take script path and parameters required for cluster setup as arguments. The function will return cluster access information in following format. .. code-block:: json { "server" : "https://123.124.64.6:8443", "username" : "some-username", "password" : "some-password" } The VNF LCM driver will map this information to ``vim_connection_info`` as shown below. It will be stored in ``vim_connection_info`` column of the ``vnf_instances`` table. Sample of ``vim_connection_info`` record stored in the database: .. code-block:: json { "vim_type": "kubernetes", "access_info": { "endpoint":"http://123.124.64.6:8443" }, "interface_info": { "username": "some-username", "password": "some-password" } } The Kubernetes cluster installation requires following parameters: TODO: The list below is incomplete. Need to identify all required parameters. * Kubernetes: * Service network CIDR * k8s API cluster IP (service subnet) * k8s API cluster (k8s subnet) * Kuryr Kubernetes: * ID of Security group for pods * ID of Subnets for Pods * ID of project * ID of Subnet for k8s services TODO: How to get parameters required for the script? One option is to get them from additionalParams of the instantiation request. Each parameter required parameter for cluster installation will have a predefined key in additionalParams. TODO: To install Kubernetes cluster, it would require IP addresses of the VMs. At the moment, the IP addresses of the VMs are not stored in database along with the ``VnfInstance`` information. Need to make provision to retrieve the IP address of the VMs based on the ``VnfcResourceInfo.compute_resource`` and decide where to store it in `vnf_instantiated_info` db table. The sequence diagram below shows how Kubernetes installation script will be invoked in VNF LCM driver: .. seqdiag:: node_width = 110; edge_length = 160; Client -> WSGIMiddleware [label = "POST /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{id}/instantiate"]; WSGIMiddleware -->> WSGIMiddleware [label = "request validation"]; Client <-- WSGIMiddleware [label = "202 Accepted"]; WSGIMiddleware -> VnfLcmDriver [label = "Trigger asynchronous task"]; VnfLcmDriver --> OpenstackDriver [label = "instantiate_vnf"]; OpenstackDriver -> OpenstackDriver [label = "LCM operation with user data"]; VnfLcmDriver <-- OpenstackDriver VnfLcmDriver -> UserScript [label = "run_script()"]; UserScript -->> UserScript [label = "collect script\n params"]; UserScript -->> UserScript [label = "execute script\n to install K8s"]; VnfLcmDriver <-- UserScript [label = "VIM config info"]; VnfLcmDriver -->> VnfLcmDriver [label = "update_vim_connection_info()"]; VNF-B: CNF instantiation ------------------------ CNF instantiation requires a VIM of type ``kubernetes``. As mentioned in above sections, the access information for the Kubernetes cluster created in VNF-A will be present in ``vim_connection_info`` column of ``vnf_instances`` table. User will call `GET /vnflcm/v1/vnf_instances/{vnfInstanceId}` API and manually register a VIM of type ``kubernetes`` using ``vimConnectionInfo`` from the response. CNF instantiation will done as specified in `Container-Network-Function`_ specification. Hence no design changes will be required for this step. The diagram below shows how CNF (VNF-B) will be deployed on Kubernetes cluster created in VNF-A: .. code-block:: none +---------+ +----------+ | Cluster | | | | Install | | VNFD | +--------------+ | Script | | | | LCM operation| +------+--+ +-+--------+ | User Data |----+ | | +--------------+ | v v +---------------+ +-----------+ | +----------+ | Instantiation | | Heat | +---->| | | Request with | | template |--------->| CSAR | | Additional | | (Base HOT)| +---->| | | Params | +-----------+ | +------+---+ +---+-----------+ +----------+ | | | |CNF | | | | |Definition|----+ +------+---------+----------------+ |YAML | | v v VNFM | +----------+ | +----------------+ | | | TackerServer | | + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -+ | +----------------+ | : VNF-A : | | | : + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - + : | | | : : VNF-B : : | v | : : +-------------------------------+ : : | +-------------------------+ | : : | +----------+ +----------+ | : : | | +---------------+ | | : : | | App | | App | | : : | | | Kubernetes | | | : : | +----------+ +----------+ | <--+---+-----+----+---| Infra Driver | | | : : | +----------+ +----------+ | : : | | +---------------+ | | : : | |Container | |Container | | : : | | ^ | | : : | +----------+ +----------+ | : : | | | | | : : +-------------------------------+ : : | | +-------+-------+ | | : : : : | | | VNF LCM | | | : + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - + : | | | Driver | | | : +-------------------------------+ : | | +---------------+ | | : | Kubernetes cluster | : | | | | : | +----------+ +----------+ | : | | +---------------+ | | : | | +------+ | | +------+ | | : | | | OpenStack | | | : | | |Worker| | | |Master| | | : | | | Infra Driver | | | : | | +------+ | | +------+ | | : | | | | | | : | | VM | | VM | | : | | +---------------+ | | : | +----------+ +----------+ | : | | | | : +-------------------------------+ : | | Tacker Conductor | | : +-------------------------------+ : | +-------------------------+ | : | Hardware | : | | : | Resources | : +---------------------------------+ : +-------------------------------+ : : : + - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -+ Implications of dependency of VNF-B on VNF-A -------------------------------------------- Since CNF-B will be deployed on the Kubernetes cluster created inside VNF-A, the operations performed on VNF-A will affect VNF-B. Termination of VNF-A ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ This will destroy VNF-B and data being processed by VNF-B will become inconsistent. For this reason VNF-B must be terminated gracefully before VNF-A. Performing such termination sequence automatically is out of scopt of this spec, hence the required sequence will be described in the user guide. Healing of VNF-A ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ The heal use case of VNF LCM sequence terminates existing VM and spawns a new replacement VM. The VM being terminated may be running Kubernetes cluster's master node. Hence it will be necessary to terminate VNF-B gracefully before performing heal operation on VNF-A. The required sequence will be described in the user guide. Alternatives ------------ VNF instantiation using VNF LCM interfaces and Mistral workflows ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~ ETSI SOL001 [#etsi-sol001]_ section 6.7.1.2 defines TOSCA operations corresponding to VNF LCM operations. If we want to implement these interfaces in VNF LCM driver, the design of the VNF LCM driver will change completely. Current VNF LCM operations are equivalent to the interfaces as mentioned below: * instantiate_start: Tasks currently performed in ``pre_instantiation_vnf``. * instantiate: Tasks currently performed in ``instantiate_vnf`` * instantiate_end: Tasks currently performed in ``post_vnf_instantiation`` User will provide implementation of these interfaces in VNFD. Tacker will provide default implementation of each supported interface. The default implementation will be used when user doesn't provide implementation of some interface. The default implementation will be basically a Mistral workflow. In context of Kubernetes cluster installation, the ``instantiate_end`` interface can be defined in the VNFD which will have Mistral workflow. This workflow will be responsible for multiple actions listed below: * Get IP addresses of VMs * Invoke Kubernetes cluster install script * Store Kubernetes cluster access information in database The parameters required for the cluster install script will be provided in the ``input`` property of the ``instantiate_end`` interface. Below is a sample VNFD: .. code-block:: yaml tosca_definitions_version: tosca_simple_yaml_1_2 description: Deployment flavour for Kubernetes Cluster with "pre_installed" flavour ID imports: - etsi_nfv_sol001_common_types.yaml - etsi_nfv_sol001_vnfd_types.yaml topology_template: inputs: descriptor_id: type: string descriptor_version: type: string provider: type: string product_name: type: string software_version: type: string vnfm_info: type: list entry_schema: type: string flavour_id: type: string flavour_description: type: string substitution_mappings: node_type: NTT.Tacker.KubernetesCluster properties: flavour_id: pre_installed node_templates: VNF: type: NTT.Tacker.Kubernetes properties: flavour_description: The pre_installed flavour interfaces: Vnflcm: instantiate_end: implementation: post-instantiate-script inputs: script_input_1: value_1 script_input_2: value_2 artifacts: post-instantiate-script: description: Instantiate workflow script type: tosca.artifacts.Implementation.nfv.Mistral file: instantiate.py #repository: .. #deploy_path: .. .. Data model impact ----------------- None REST API impact --------------- None Security impact --------------- None Notifications impact -------------------- None Other end user impact --------------------- None Performance impact ------------------ None Other deployer impact --------------------- None Developer impact ---------------- None Implementation ============== Assignee(s) ----------- Primary assignee: Yoshito Ito <yoshito.itou.dr@hco.ntt.co.jp> Other contributors: Nitin Uikey <nitin.uikey@nttdata.com> Tushar Patil <tushar.vitthal.patil@gmail.com> Prashant Bhole <prashant.bhole@nttdata.com> Work Items ---------- TODO Dependencies ============ None Testing ======= Unit and functional tests will be added to cover cases required in the spec. Documentation Impact ==================== * Complete user guide will be added to explain CNF instantiation on Kubernetes cluster inside VM. * The procedure for terminating the VNFs will be described in the user guide. commit_message:
Add TLS version configuration for pools

Add field tls_versions to pools for restricing TLS versions used.
This is a colon-separated string of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3

Add default_pool_tls_versions in octavia.conf

Note: TLSv1.3 connections will use haproxy's default ciphers
instead of the listener's tls_ciphers field

Change-Id: I480b7fb9756d98ba9dbcdfd1d4b193ce6868e291
Story: 2006733
Task: 37173
Depends-On: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb

subject: Add TLS version configuration for listeners
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-04-20 23:12:53.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/octavia/commit/b0e882f6838351d620304b0609a1838480108dbd', 'message': 'Add TLS version configuration for listeners

Add field tls_versions to listeners for restricting TLS versions used.
This is a colon-separated string of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2

Add default_listener_tls_versions in octavia.conf.

Although this does not explicitly include support for the TLSv1.3
option found in newer versions of haproxy (1.8-dev2+), TLSv1.3 will
always be used when it is available.  The restriction of TLS versions
is accomplished with flags that disable unused versions (no-sslv3,
no-tls10, etc.), so by not supporting the no-tlsv13 flag, TLSv1.3 will
always be enabled when present.

Change-Id: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb
Story: 2006733
Task: 37170

commit_message:
Add TLS version configuration for listeners

Add field tls_versions to listeners for restricting TLS versions used.
This is a list of versions to be used.
Available values (as defined in octavia-lib):
SSLv3, TLSv1, TLSv1.1, TLSv1.2, TLSv1.3

Add default_listener_tls_versions in octavia.conf.

Note that at this time TLS 1.3 ciphersuites are not impelemented,
so any TLS 1.3 connections will use haproxy's default ciphers
instead of what's specified by tls_ciphers.

Change-Id: Ic33d9b9a256490ae1b048cdfd2475d6340509fdb
Story: 2006733
Task: 37170
Task: 37169

subject: Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2020-06-04 06:04:54.000000000', 'files': ['masakari/tests/unit/engine/test_engine_mgr.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/engine/drivers/taskflow/test_process_failure_flow.py', 'masakari/tests/unit/compute/test_nova.py', 'masakari/compute/nova.py', 'masakari/engine/drivers/taskflow/process_failure.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/masakari/commit/071e500568450763945ed4bf8bca4ddfc0b122f6', 'message': 'Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled

In masakari/compute/nova.py, the method is_service_down checks whether service
status is enabled or not, rather than service up or down, so we fix it
first.

Change-Id: I030b8db9a6fa6db7b59aae2dcbfac224dfe493c8
Closes-Bug: #1882005
'}]
commit_message:
Change method name is_service_down to is_service_disabled

In masakari/compute/nova.py, the method is_service_down checks whether service
status is enabled or not, rather than service up or down, so we fix it
first.

Change-Id: I030b8db9a6fa6db7b59aae2dcbfac224dfe493c8
Closes-Bug: #1882005
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/masakari refs/changes/34/733434/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
